column4: here on Ubuntu 7.10 I have nautilus freezing everytime I open it from terminal, panel/menu and/or I try to delete a file. Obviously, no error reported
check your /var/log files, they maybe recording errors?
I looked for "something" on /var/log, but I did not find anything particular... Is there a particular file I should look into?
check the time stamps, and look at the ones that match with the time of your problems.
nothing particular in /var/log, only the usual "unknown key pressed"
it's an usual pattern for me, from ubuntu 5.10, using italian keyboard
what are you running now, how did you upgrade form 5.10?
I am running a "fresh" install of 7.10
I was only saying I have always seen that error, also when I was using 5.10, 6.06, 6.10, 7.04... same old story
ok so you followed the upgrade path, good. And this problem goes all the way back to 5.10? Have you looked for bug reports/fixes? If not, I would file a bug report.

no, that problem goes back only 4 days, on that 7.10, not upgraded from 7.04. The only things that goes back to 5.10, not showing any problem, is the error message saying "unknown key code" or someting similar
hmm, i don't know what to tell you, I'm running Dapper 6.06.
ok, thank you for your time... now I am trying purging nautilus and seeing what does it happen when I reinstall it...
